This is the COMPLETE discography of the amazing duo known as Designer Drugs - this includes amazing full mixes (with mostly complete setlists!), remixes, and of course their complete studio releases to my knowledge.
If you've never heard these guys make musical magic, I HIGHLY recommend taking their remixes and/or DATAMIXES out for a spin as they'll hook into you and pull you into wanting more and more!

It is also a fairly large torrent so I will only seed this for a short time as I unfortunately cannot bare the bandwidth toll too much from a torrent of this size.


From The Band's Bio:

Where past productions and remixes have been on the poppier end of the musical spectrum, Hardcore conjures up a darker, edgier vibe Ã¢â‚¬â€œ think the throbbing, industrial-heavy opening club scene in "The Doom Generation" Ã¢â‚¬â€œ yet still retains a melodic center on many of the tracks. "I think we're making music for the apocalypse," says Michael, only half-joking. "The state of society is at a place where people just don't give a fuck and that's what inspires our music."

On Hardcore/Softcore, numerous sounds saddle up against each other, proving the title's veracity. The punishing electro-industrial punk of "Dead Meat" and grinding, pounding beat of club bangers "Face Melter" and "The Terror" provide contrast to the pop vocals of Norwegian singer Annie on "Crazy For You" and fist-pumping up-tempo anthem "Into The Light." Elsewhere, the classic electro-funk of "Leather Gang" sits comfortably against the Italo-shoegaze of "For All We Know" and lead single "Through The Prism" (out 10/26, Ultra Music), the new electro classic featuring Cerebral Vortex. In stark contrast to albums that sound like they're on repeat by track four, Hardcore/Softcore 's myriad styles are a welcome change from many electronic LPs.
